title: Electric flux - compare cube faces ABCD and EFGH

content.question: A small, insulating, uniformly charged sphere is located at the midpoint of one edge of a larger cube, as shown in the figure. Which of the following correctly relates the magnitude <math alttext="Phi sub A B C D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>ABCD</mtext></msub></math> of the electric flux through face <math alttext="A B C D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ABCD</mi></math> to the magnitude <math alttext="Phi sub E F G H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>EFGH</mtext></msub></math> of the electric flux through face <math alttext="E F G H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>EFGH</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="Phi sub A B C D, is greater than, Phi sub E F G H, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>ABCD</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>EFGH</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Phi sub A B C D, is greater than, Phi sub E F G H, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>ABCD</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>EFGH</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Phi sub E F G H, is greater than, Phi sub A B C D, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>EFGH</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>ABCD</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Phi sub E F G H, is greater than, Phi sub A B C D, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>EFGH</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>ABCD</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Phi sub E F G H, is greater than, Phi sub A B C D, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>EFGH</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>ABCD</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
